message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.GR 

This paper deals with color constancy, which is a problem in computer vision related to color correction. The paper proposes a Bayesian framework that uses a multi-hypothesis strategy to handle color constancy ambiguity. This involves selecting a set of candidate scene illuminants and estimating the likelihood of the light source being achromatic. The paper also uses a camera-agnostic CNN to enable effective multi-camera training. Given these factors, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is computer vision (cs.CV). Other likely sub-categories include machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), multimedia (cs.MM), and graphics (cs.GR).
